meanings.def: to be greater than a particular number or amount
examples: Their numbers barely exceed 100 in the wild.
The House voted by 327 votes to 93, comfortably exceeding the required two-thirds majority.

meanings.def: to do more than the law or an order, etc. allows you to do
examples: She was exceeding the speed limit (= driving faster than is allowed).
The officers had exceeded their authority.
The amount raised has far exceeded our wildest expectations.
